articles.headline: Justice Dept. Will Seek to Block 2 Health Insurance Mergers
articles.snippet: Antitrust officials are concerned that Aetna’s deal with Humana and Anthem’s pursuit of Cigna would harm competition in the health insurance industry.
articles.abstract: Antitrust officials are concerned that Aetna’s deal with Humana and Anthem’s pursuit of Cigna would harm competition in the health insurance industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department is preparing lawsuits to block two giant health insurance deals, according to a person briefed on the matter, continuing a spate of antitrust actions in a whirlwind year for mergers and acquisitions.
articles.byline: By Leslie Picker and Reed Abelson

articles.headline: Accused of Sexual Harassment, Roger Ailes Is Negotiating Exit From Fox
articles.snippet: The company has been investigating accusations of sexual harassment in a lawsuit filed against him.
articles.abstract: The company has been investigating accusations of sexual harassment in a lawsuit filed against him.
articles.lead_paragraph: Roger Ailes’s tenure as the head of Fox News appears to be over.
articles.byline: By John Koblin and Jim Rutenberg

articles.headline: Turkey Pursues Cleric Living in U.S., Blamed as Coup Mastermind
articles.snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan says Fethullah Gulen was behind a coup attempt last week that almost succeeded in taking over the state and killing Mr. Erdogan himself.
articles.abstract: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan says Fethullah Gulen was behind a coup attempt last week that almost succeeded in taking over the state and killing Mr. Erdogan himself.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — Turkey’s president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, says that a mild-mannered Muslim cleric living in self-imposed exile in rural Pennsylvania was pulling the strings of a coup attempt last week that almost succeeded in taking over the state, and killing Mr. Erdogan himself.
articles.byline: By Tim Arango and Ben Hubbard

articles.headline: How Melania Trump’s Speech Veered Off Course and Caused an Uproar
articles.snippet: Two veteran Republican speechwriters had created a draft last month. But inside Trump Tower, it turned out, Ms. Trump began tearing it apart.
articles.abstract: Two veteran Republican speechwriters had created a draft last month. But inside Trump Tower, it turned out, Ms. Trump began tearing it apart.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — It was the biggest speech of Melania Trump’s life, and her husband, Donald, wanted it to be perfect.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Michael Barbaro

articles.headline: Black Republicans See a White Convention, Heavy on Lectures
articles.snippet: For many black Republicans, speeches have veered toward moralizing on race, an off-putting posture given Donald J. Trump’s unpopularity with minority voters.
articles.abstract: For many black Republicans, speeches have veered toward moralizing on race, an off-putting posture given Donald J. Trump’s unpopularity with minority voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — Mike Hill, a black Republican state representative in Florida, grew steadily more disheartened as he watched television clips of his party’s overwhelmingly white national convention lecturing African-Americans about the police and race relations.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy, Yamiche Alcindor and Jeremy W. Peters

articles.headline: Roger Ailes Stares Into the Abyss From Atop the TV News World
articles.snippet: The Republican convention has been a triumph for Mr. Ailes’s brand of smash-mouth and “politically incorrect” politics, but it comes as his own career at Fox News has unraveled.
articles.abstract: The Republican convention has been a triumph for Mr. Ailes’s brand of smash-mouth and “politically incorrect” politics, but it comes as his own career at Fox News has unraveled.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — Donald J. Trump’s coronation as the Republican nominee for president Tuesday night was a signal accomplishment not only for the candidate, but also for the man who commands the most important control room in American politics: the Fox News chairman Roger Ailes.

articles.headline: U.S. Targets $1 Billion in Assets in Malaysian Embezzlement Case
articles.snippet: The Justice Department is seeking to seize more than $1 billion in assets bought with money that it believes was stolen from 1MDB, a Malaysian sovereign wealth fund.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department is seeking to seize more than $1 billion in assets bought with money that it believes was stolen from 1MDB, a Malaysian sovereign wealth fund.
articles.lead_paragraph: A $30.6 million penthouse at the Time Warner Center in Manhattan, overlooking Central Park. A $39 million mansion in the Los Angeles hills. A $17.5 million tear-down in Beverly Hills. Each was bought anonymously, the source of its financing hidden.

articles.headline: Peter Thiel’s Embrace of Trump Has Silicon Valley Squirming
articles.snippet: A speech by the billionaire co-founder of PayPal at the Republican convention could spoil a delicate but growing relationship between tech and the G.O.P.
articles.abstract: A speech by the billionaire co-founder of PayPal at the Republican convention could spoil a delicate but growing relationship between tech and the G.O.P.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the technology investor Peter Thiel takes the stage just before Donald J. Trump at the Republican convention this week, he will become the most prominent public face of a species so endangered it might as well be called extinct: the Silicon Valley Trump supporter.

articles.headline: HSBC Bank Executives Face Charges in $3.5 Billion Currency Case
articles.snippet: Federal prosecutors charge the bankers with engaging in a front-running scheme related to a foreign exchange transaction in 2011.
articles.abstract: Federal prosecutors charge the bankers with engaging in a front-running scheme related to a foreign exchange transaction in 2011.
articles.lead_paragraph: The global banking giant HSBC has repeatedly found itself in the cross hairs of American regulators and prosecutors in recent years. To settle allegations of money-laundering and mortgage abuses, it has paid billions of dollars — but has not been criminally charged.
